resources.string:
‚õµ This service allows compatible applications to easily counteract small device movements within their user interface.

üèùÔ∏è This can improve screen readability and possibly alleviate motion sickness while on the go, e.g. while reading in a moving vehicle.

üõ°Ô∏è The app needs your permission to know which window is visible on the screen. It does not read window contents.

‚ÑπÔ∏è Find more info, implementation details and examples on:

github.com/Sublimis/SteadyScreen

‚õµ This service allows compatible applications to easily counteract small device movements within their user interface.

üèùÔ∏è This can improve screen readability and possibly alleviate motion sickness while on the go, e.g. while reading in a moving vehicle.

‚ö° The application has been crafted very meticulously, in order to minimize resource usage and maximize performance.

Hope you enjoy it üòä
Help translate this app and get a free license! More info:
This application is free and works without limitations. However, the parameters will return to their default values after 1 hour without a license.

This application needs the AccessibilityService API to retrieve interactive windows on the screen, in order to find compatible ones.\n\nThe service then sends multiple \"move window\" accessibility actions to such windows, as needed, to perform the intended function.

Shake the device a little. Notice how the background content softens these movements, making on-screen reading easier. (Stilly service must be enabled in the Accessibility settings for this to happen.)\n\nThis functionality can be easily implemented in any application. Please follow the instructions on GitHub.
Service is disabled, click here to enable.
This sets the desired sensor rate. Higher values may consume more battery. This may differ from the measured sensor rate as the system ultimately decides which rate to provide.
Increasing this will slow down and attenuate movements, making them less sensitive to larger forces.
Increasing this will reduce sensitivity to small oscillations and make movements less sensitive to larger forces.
This scales the movements linearly, making them larger or smaller without affecting the calculations.
This scales the forces before calculations, which in turn affects the overall magnitude of movements.
Current sensor rate as measured by the app. This may differ from the desired sensor rate as the system ultimately decides which rate to provide.
Thanks! Please write a nice review or rate us 5 stars on the Play Store.
Some error occurred. Please try again.
The app was licensed successfully. Thank you for your support!
